core

Class KeyStoreManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.KeyStoreManager

  • public class KeyStoreManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods to manage a KeyStore A KeyStoreManager contains a KeyStore and a password and allow to seek for key, add or remove key.
    Author:
    Alexandre Colicchio, Andy Chabalier, Philippe Letaif, Thibaud Gasser
    See Also:
    KeyStore

    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyStoreManager

        public KeyStoreManager(java.lang.String path,
                       java.lang.String password)
                throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException,
                       java.io.IOException
        Constructor for a Keystore Manager with KeyStore type in JCEKS.
        Parameters:
        path - Path of the KeyStore
        password - Password of the KeyStore
        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkRead method denies read access to the file.
        java.io.IOException - if the file does not exist, is a directory rather than a regular file, or for some other reason cannot be opened for reading.
        See Also:
        KeyStoreManager(String path, String keyStoreType, String password)

      • KeyStoreManager

        public KeyStoreManager(java.lang.String path,
                       java.lang.String keyStoreType,
                       java.lang.String password)
                throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException,
                       java.io.IOException
        Second constructor for a Keystore Manager. The type of the KeyStore is determinated by the input argument : KeyStoreType
        Parameters:
        path - Path of the KeyStore
        keyStoreType - Type of the KeyStore (ex: JCEKS)
        password - Password of the KeyStore
        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkRead method denies read access to the file.
        java.io.IOException - if the file does not exist, is a directory rather than a regular file, or for some other reason cannot be opened for reading.
        See Also:
        SecurityManager.checkRead(java.lang.String)

    • Method Detail

      • getKeyStore

        public java.security.KeyStore getKeyStore()
        Give the KeyStore instance
        Returns:
        The KeyStore instance

      • getPrivateKey

        public java.security.PrivateKey getPrivateKey(java.security.PublicKey publicKey,
                                              java.lang.String passwd)
                                       throws java.security.KeyStoreException,
                                              java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException,
                                              java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Look for a private key that matches the public key
        Parameters:
        publicKey - User public key
        passwd - User password
        Returns:
        The private key wanted if it's founded.
        Throws:
        java.security.KeyStoreException - if the keystore has not been initialized (loaded).
        java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException - if the key cannot be recovered (e.g., the given password is wrong).
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm for recovering the key cannot be found

      • addPrivateKey

        public void addPrivateKey(java.lang.String alias,
                          java.security.cert.Certificate cert,
                          java.security.PrivateKey privateKey)
                   throws java.security.KeyStoreException,
                          java.io.IOException,
                          java.security.cert.CertificateException
        Add a private key to the KeyStore with its alias and certificate.
        Parameters:
        alias - Alias of the private key.
        cert - Certificate of the private key.
        privateKey - The private key.
        Throws:
        java.security.KeyStoreException - if the keystore has not been initialized (loaded), the given key cannot be protected, or this operation fails for some other reason.
        java.io.IOException - if some I/O problem occur.
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - if some certificate problem occur.

      • deleteEntry

        public void deleteEntry(java.lang.String alias)
                 throws java.security.KeyStoreException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Delete a private key by its alias
        Parameters:
        alias - Alias of the key to delete.
        Throws:
        java.security.KeyStoreException - if the keystore has not been initialized, or if the entry cannot be removed.
        java.io.IOException - if some I/O problem occur.
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - if some certificate problem occur.

      • saveKeystore

        private void saveKeystore()
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          java.security.cert.CertificateException
        Stores this keystore to the private member class path, and protects its integrity with the private member class password.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there was an I/O problem with data
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - if any of the certificates included in the keystore data could not be stored
